overview: This subject introduces students to a major research topic in musicology, ethnomusicology, or popular music studies through guided readings, discussions and a research project.
Topic, reading list, project timeline and format are agreed upon in collaboration between student and honours coordinator before the semester begins.
This subject is co-taught with MUSI30269 Music in Australia. Students cannot simultaneously enrol in co-taught subjects in the same study period.
ilo: identify and critique major perspectives and methods associated with a contemporary topic or area in academic music studies;
compare and assess how major topics in music studies have been applied to different contexts and time periods;
find and assess the secondary literature on a major issue in the study of music;
craft and answer a research question related to a major topic in music studies using primary, secondary and tertiary sources as appropriate.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Research project - 2000 words or equivalent (excluding references)

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours, comprising one 2-hour seminar per week.
